title: Executive Order 12624-Increasing the Number of Members on the President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board
content: By the authority vested in me as President by the Constitution and laws of the United States of America, it is hereby ordered that Executive Order No. 12537 of October 28, 1985, is amended by deleting the word "fourteen" from the second sentence of Section 1 and inserting in its place the word "sixteen."
[Filed with the Office of the Federal Register, 4:48 p.m., January 6, 1988]
citation: Ronald Reagan, Executive Order 12624-Increasing the Number of Members on the President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/253067
